H0.text: where is traditional chinese used. Taiwan

H1.text: where is traditional chinese used. Hong Kong

H2.text: where is traditional chinese used. Macau

H3.text: where is traditional chinese used. Shěn

A4.text: Traditional Chinese characters are used in Taiwan, where the set of traditional characters is regulated by the Ministry of Education and standardized in the Standard Form of National Characters.

A5.text: There are differences between the accepted traditional forms in mainland China and elsewhere, for example the accepted traditional form of 产 in mainland China is 産 (also the accepted form in Japan and Korea), while in Hong Kong, Macau and Taiwan the accepted form is 產 (also the accepted form in Vietnamese chữ Nôm).

A6.text: Many legal documents in Taiwan are still written in Classical Chinese.
